thread.title: Coworking office operator Common Desk heads to Plano with new lease
thread.title_full: Coworking office operator Common Desk heads to Plano with new lease

author: Steve Brown
title: Coworking office operator Common Desk heads to Plano with new lease
text:
Get Unlimited Digital Access Your first month is less than a dollar. $0.99 for first 4 weeks Subscribe Now 
A Dallas-based shared office firm is heading to West Plano for a large new operation. 
Common Desk is renting two floors in the Granite Park V tower near the southwest corner of the Dallas North Tollway and State Highway 121. 
The coworking firm is taking 27,532 square feet of the building's first and second floors. 
Common Desk's new Plano facility will have open, collaborative working areas, private offices and meeting space and will cater to independent contractors, entrepreneurs, start up businesses and corporate tenants 
"We are opening our largest location to date at Granite Park because of the accessibility, walkability, and visibility provided by Granite Park," Nick Clark, Founder of Common Desk, said in a statement. "We are confident Plano is more than ready for their first coworking concept." 
The new facility will be Common Desk's third location in the Dallas area. The firm also operates shared office centers in Deep Ellum and Oak Cliff. 
The Granite Park location will open this spring. Entos Design is the architect for the space. 
"We are excited to have Common Desk in the Park," Granite Properties President Greg Fuller said. "We believe that the vibrant community they create will be a great flexible option for small businesses as well as our corporate tenants in the area." 
Granite Park V is a 12-story, 306,000 square-foot office building. 
Granite Properties is currently building a 10-story, 330,000-square-foot building on the south side of S.H. 121 that will house regional operations for mortgage giant Fannie Mae. 
More than 3 million square feet of buildings are located in Granite Park. View Comments
